trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Directions on Microsoft | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Directions on Microsoft | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Directions on Microsoft with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Directions on Microsoft with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure Active Directory and Directions on Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure Active Directory and Directions on Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Directions on Microsoft subscription
trans-unit.target: A Directions on Microsoft subscription

trans-unit.source: If you don’t have a federated Directions on Microsoft subscription yet, email a request to “service@DirectionsOnMicrosoft.com”.
trans-unit.target: If you don’t have a federated Directions on Microsoft subscription yet, email a request to “service@DirectionsOnMicrosoft.com”.

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure Active Directory users you have assigned to Directions on Microsoft will be able to single sign into the application using single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure Active Directory users you have assigned to Directions on Microsoft will be able to single sign into the application using single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Directions on Microsoft
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Directions on Microsoft

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Directions on Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Directions on Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Directions on Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Directions on Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Directions on Microsoft, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Directions on Microsoft, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Directions on Microsoft with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Directions on Microsoft with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Directions on Microsoft application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Directions on Microsoft application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Directions on Microsoft page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Directions on Microsoft page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Microsoft Azure AD Singel Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Microsoft Azure AD Singel Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Sign On URL textbox, type https://www.directionsonmicrosoft.com/user/login, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Sign On URL textbox, type https://www.directionsonmicrosoft.com/user/login, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Directions on Microsoft page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Directions on Microsoft page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Send the metadata file to the Directions on Microsoft support team (service@DirectionsOnMicrosoft.com).
trans-unit.target: Send the metadata file to the Directions on Microsoft support team (service@DirectionsOnMicrosoft.com).

trans-unit.source: To enable the Directions on Microsoft support team to locate your federated site membership, include your company information in your email.
trans-unit.target: To enable the Directions on Microsoft support team to locate your federated site membership, include your company information in your email.

trans-unit.source: Single sign-on for Directions on Microsoft needs to be enabled by the Directions on Microsoft support team.
trans-unit.target: Single sign-on for Directions on Microsoft needs to be enabled by the Directions on Microsoft support team.

trans-unit.source: You will receive a notification when single sign-on has been enabled.
trans-unit.target: You will receive a notification when single sign-on has been enabled.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Directions on Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Directions on Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: When an assigned user tries to log into Directions on Microsoft using the access panel, Directions on Microsoft checks whether the user exists.
trans-unit.target: When an assigned user tries to log into Directions on Microsoft using the access panel, Directions on Microsoft checks whether the user exists.

trans-unit.source: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Directions on Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Directions on Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Directions on Microsoft **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Directions on Microsoft **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
